text: Life lived for tomorrow will always be just a day away from being realized.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: Be faithful to that which exists within yourself.
author: Andre Gide

text: Curiosity will conquer fear even more than bravery will.
author: James Stephens

text: I am still learning.
author: Michelangelo

text: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

text: What sculpture is to a block of marble, education is to the soul.
author: Joseph Addison

text: To be or not to be. That's not really a question.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

text: What we really are matters more than what other people think of us.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: You may delay, but time will not.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: When your work speaks for itself, don't interrupt.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

text: Kites rise highest against the wind - not with it.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: There is nothing permanent except change.
author: Heraclitus

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
author: Margaret Mead

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato

text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

text: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
author: Audrey Hepburn
